metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9835 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The gs_alloc_ref_array function in psi/ialloc.c in Artifex Ghostscript 9.21 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PostScript document. This is related to a lack of an integer overflow check in base/gsalloc.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7').
